thread.title: Lamar Odom out of coma, has spoken and is breathing on his own
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom out of coma, has spoken and is breathing on his own | Examiner.com

author: Margaret Minnicks
title: Lamar Odom out of coma, has spoken and is breathing on his own
text:
Play A ray of hope has shown through on Lamar Odom's condition. The former nab player’s heart is getting stronger. on.aol.com Good news has been announced about Lamar Odom 's condition. Breaking news reported by E! Online on Friday that the former basketball player is out of the coma he has been in since Tuesday. He has spoken and is breathing on his own. Doctors have confirmed that he is on the road to recovery.
The 35-year-old former NBA player became comatose following an incident at a brothel in Nevada and was unable to communicate until today. Odom reportedly opened his eyes and spoke to his wife, Khloé Kardashian, who has been by his bedside since his hospitalization. He said, "Hey, baby," gave her a thumbs up and then went back to sleep. It was reported that Odom is no longer using a breathing tube. Fox News reported that Odom's aunt confirmed that he is out of the coma.
Khloé, 31, has been under a lot of pressure since Lamar's hospitalization. She is quite relieved that there has been some signs of life even though Lamar had a long way to go for complete healing. While in the hospital, Odom was hooked up to a ventilator, and his condition was described as critical. Doctors said he likely suffered multiple strokes, and he could have severe physical and mental impairment. He was given a 50-50 chance of coming out of the coma, but he did.
Basketball fans and others around the world have expressed support for Odom, his family, and the Kardashians. His friend, Kobe Bryant, visited Odom at the hospital, and others have expressed their support on social media. While it didn't look so good initially, it is good news that Lamar has opened his eyes, has spoken and is now breathing on his own.
